alert.note: Alert for Swain (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 27 at 9:34AM EDT until May 27 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the Tuckasegee River At Bryson City... ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Tuckasegee River At Bryson City. * WHEN...Until this evening. * IMPACTS...between 10 and 11 feet, Low lying areas between Bryson Walk and the river flood. Upstream between Main Street and the river, low lying areas including parts of the Bear Hunter Campground will flood. Old River Rd is flooding. Low lying areas along Island and Collins Streets may flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:16 AM EDT Friday the stage was 10.9 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:16 AM EDT Friday was 12.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage by late this afternoon. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. For detailed information including observed and forecast stages, flood impacts, flood history, FEMA Flood Hazard Layers, and more, please visit: https://water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=gsp
